body: Sounds like this is related to #352? It's kind of a big problem and it would be nice to get it fixed.

issue.title: Add support for preserving context when importing

repository.name: jinja
repository.description: A very fast and expressive template engine.

body: Oops, I guess that'll teach me to force push!
It's definitely intentional but I'm not sure what happens now if we change it. Will investigate as part of #637
I'm super undecided on what to do with this. If we want to change this then I'm all for deriving a context for blocks the same way as we do for includes and imports.

issue.title: Recursive macros work only when defined at some special places

repository.name: jinja
repository.description: A very fast and expressive template engine.

issue.title: Strange variable scope with extends and include

repository.name: jinja
repository.description: A very fast and expressive template engine.

issue.body:
Here is the setup: test_include.html : ``` html

Var: {{ var }}

``` test_base.html : ``` html Test

Test

{% include 'test_include.html' %} ``` test.html : ``` html {% extends 'test_base.html' %} {% set var = 'foobar' %} ``` This results in a page that looks like: ``` html ...

Test

Var:

... ``` So var is not accessible in the include. But if you add something like `{{var}}` or `{% if var %}{% endif %}` to test_base.html the result looks like: ``` html ...

Test

Var: foobar

... ``` So just by accessing var in test_base (no matter if before or after the include) var is also accessible within test_include.

body: Related issue is #546 where variables do not propagate to include because derived contexts are based on the parent and not local scope.

Does this also fix the strange behavior when overwriting a block that the parent template included? Minimal example: ``` templates/ |--base.html |--nav.html +--page.html ``` ***base.html*** ``` Title {% include 'nav.html' %} {% block content %}{% endblock %} ``` ***nav.html*** ```

Header 1

{% block more_headers %}{% endblock %} ``` ***page.html*** ``` {% extends 'base.html' %} {% block more_headers %}

Second header!

{% endblock %} {% block content %} Content! {% endblock %} ``` Rendering `page.html` will not output the `h2`.

@roba91 you can test that against the latest code to find out if it's fixed. Either way, that seems like a different issue. Please make a different post if there isn't one already.

Actually, I don't think that's even an issue, did extended templates ever see included blocks in parent templates?

issue.title: Fix regression in 2.9 involving unsafe Context.get_all() usage

repository.name: jinja
repository.description: A very fast and expressive template engine.

issue.body:
Since commit d67f0fd4cc2a4af08f51f4466150d49da7798729, callers
of Context.get_all() need to make a copy it they're going to
modify the result.

Fixes: d67f0fd4cc2a ("Generalize scoping.  This fixes #603")
See: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/20494

@mitsuhiko, PTAL
